alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:14AM EDT until July 11 at 11:37PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 419.0 feet, Water will flood fields behind the Vermont State Office Complex in Waterbury. Field flooding will occur from Waterbury downstream through Richmond. At 421.0 feet, Water will approach low lying parking lots at the Waterbury State Office complex, and Rowe Field in Waterbury will flood. Downstream in Richmond, Bridge Street at the Winooski bridge near the Round Church will be inundated, and the Richmond public park will flood. The river will be out of its banks from Waterbury downstream through Richmond, with considerable field flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 417.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 419.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 419.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EDT.
